etymology.description: 氏(氏) (shì, "clan") + 日(日) (rì, "sun") = sun lowering -> phonetic component
etymology.interpretation: The character uses the image of the sun setting or lowering to convey an associated sound, serving as a phonetic component in compounds. Unlike 昏(昏) (hūn, "dusk"), it doesn't form an independent word but contributes phonetically in other characters.

examples.chinese: 许多形声字使用𠯑(𠯑)，表示音旁作用(表示音旁作用)。
examples.pinyin: Xǔ duō xíng shēng zì shǐ yòng 𠯑, biǎo shì yīn páng zuò yòng.
examples.english: Many phono-semantic compound characters use 𠯑 to indicate a phonetic component.

examples.chinese: 在字典中(在字典中)，学者探讨了𠯑的音读功能(學者探討了𠯑的音讀功能)。
examples.pinyin: Zài zìdiǎn zhōng, xué zhě tàn tǎo le 𠯑 de yīn dú gōng néng.
examples.english: In the dictionary, scholars have explored the phonetic reading function of 𠯑.

examples.chinese: 很多生僻字包含𠯑(𠯑)，提供了声音线索(提供了聲音線索)。
examples.pinyin: Hěn duō shēng pì zì bāo hán 𠯑, tí gōng le shēng yīn xiàn suǒ.
examples.english: Many obscure characters include 𠯑, providing a clue to pronunciation.
